results.name: default/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-9f4b6648b-vr9hn], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service is missing ready endpoints because the pod mysql-9f4b6648b-vr9hn isn't ready.  
Solution: 1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`. 2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs mysql-9f4b6648b-vr9hn`. 3. Verify readiness probe settings. 4. Ensure pod dependencies are available. 5. Restart pod if needed.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-6f965f955c-vl4zz], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service lacks ready endpoints because the expected pod is not ready.  
Solution: 1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`. 2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod wordpress-6f965f955c-vl4zz`. 3. Look for issues in events or logs. 4. Resolve any errors found. 5. Ensure the pod becomes ready.

results.name: default/mysql-9f4b6648b-vr9hn
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "mysql:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check Kubernetes node permissions.
5. Try a specific version tag instead of "latest".

results.name: default/wordpress-6f965f955c-vl4zz
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.
